abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Provincial
            Development Project for Argentina were as follows: the
            outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project are as follows: The project
            structure combining public sector management and
            infrastructure was too complex. Subnational Governments
            institutional strengthening projects should be focused in
            terms of the areas of intervention and number of clients.
            Projects aimed at provincial changes should offer a flexible
            but limited menu of assistance to address the variety of
            circumstances and reform needs. The menu, however, needs to
            reflect national priorities while respecting the autonomy of
            provincial governments. Supervision of subnational lending
            programs is complex costly and requires special provisions.
            The require diversity of provincial conditions and
            priorities make for heterogeneous project conditions, which
            may tailor-made solutions.
